intro: Tomanthea insignis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color, with a distinctive spurred shape at the base. Tomanthea insignis is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
